transcript.p: Ran-Away from the subscriber, living in Clarke county, Kentucky, on the 20th of December, 1809 a Negro Man named

, around thirty-siz years of age, judged to he about five feet six inches high, very artful, has a scar on his forehead, and I believe a split in one of his finger nails; he carried with him a black pair of linsey overalls, also one black pair of condutoy overalls, a blue broad-cloth surtout coat, a brown great-coat, a black sattin wast-coast, an old fur hat dressed over, a pair of shoes laced up before, and a pair of boots; but it is probable he may have changed both his clothes and his names. It is expected some person has given him a pass. He took away with him a dark bay Horse, about 14 and 1-2 bands high, with a blushy tail, and I believe he has a small star on in his foreheed, but cannot recollect whether he is branded or not. I expect he will crossOhio. Besides what the law allows, I will liberally reward any person who will deliver said Negro man and horse, or either of them, to me, or secure said Negro man in any jail in the United States so that I can get him again. Whoever takes him up must be extremely cautious or he will make his escape.
